page.title: 12Beaches in Morwenstow
page.content: Only one beach in the parish can be reached by car. It is called{Duckpool and is on the border of Morwenstow and Kilkhampton parish. There is sand at low tide but sea bathing is dangerous when the tide is going out because of strong currents pulling away from the beach. The car park belongs to the National Trust. There are sand bays here and at{Stanbury}where sand was stored to wait for the farmers to collect with their donkey carts. {Stanbury Mouth }is reached by a track which follows a stream nearly all the way down to the sea. This beach too has sand at low tide. {Warren Gutter has a footpath winding down the high and shaley cliffs. It derives its name from a rabbit warren kept for shooting by the local squires many years ago. The beach is part sand and boulders.
